patterns: What are the types of memberships

responses: We offer a range of membership options such as Peak, Off-Peak, Club Plus, Club Platinum and Diamond - each offering different entitlements. Please visit your local club for a tour and to duscuss membership options and princing further. We also have a selection of member benefits, such as money off Mindful Chef - a food delivery subscription service. I hope this helps!

responses:
Thank you for your interest in joining David Lloyd Clubs! We have different options available so that you can be sure you get the package that is most suited to you and your needs – whether that’s using our unrivalled facilities to help you feel good or spending time together as a family.
Please visit the following link to further enquire about joining and choose the right package for you. 
https://www.davidlloyd.co.uk/memberships 
If you would like to add someone onto your exisiting membership, please contact the sales team in your home club. I hope this helps!

responses: You can freeze your membership for up to 9 months if you're going to be away and not using the club for an extended peroid of time. Please contact your club directly to organise this. Please note: this is not the same as leaving.

patterns: How do I sign up for personal training sessions at the gym?
What qualifications do the personal trainers at the gym have?
Can you tell me more about the experience of the personal trainers at the gym?
Are there group personal training sessions available at the gym?
What is the cost of personal training sessions at the gym?
responses:
We offer personalised training sessions with certified personal trainers who are dedicated to helping you achieve your fitness goals. Our trainers are experienced and knowledgeable, and will work with you to create a customized workout plan that is tailored to your individual needs and preferences. We also offer group training sessions for those who prefer to workout in a social and supportive environment. The cost of personal training sessions varies based on the duration and frequency of the sessions, and we also offer package deals for multiple sessions. If you're interested in signing up for personal training at David Lloyd, please speak to one of our team members at the gym or contact us through our website for more information. 
All personal trainers are at least Level 3 Fitness Coach certified. Indervidual profiles about out PTs can be found in the David Lloyd app!

patterns: How do I sign up for swimming lessons
What types of swimming lessons are offered
Are there swimming lessons available for children and adults
What is the cost of swimming lessons
Are the swimming lessons taught by certified instructors
responses: We offer a range of swimming lessons for both adults and kids. All of our instructors are certified with at least Level 2 Swim England qualifications, so you can trust that you'll be receiving top-notch instruction. Our swimming lessons are available in both group and private sessions, and we offer a variety of class levels to accommodate all skill levels, from beginner to advanced. If you're interested in signing up for swimming lessons, you can book directly through our mobile app or in person at the club. Our private lessons are a great option for those who prefer one-on-one instruction or have specific goals in mind. Pricing for swimming lessons varies based on the duration and frequency of the sessions. Whether you're looking to improve your technique or just learn how to swim, our instructors are here to help you achieve your goals. I hope this helps!

For local club queries, it's best to call the club directly (The phone number for Solihull Cranmore is: 0121 733 5300). Alternatively, you can email the club: solihullcranmore@davidlloyd.co.uk. 
If you're looking for a sales tour, please book a tour through this link: https://www.davidlloyd.co.uk/clubs/solihull-cranmore/ 
Finally, you can follow us on our instagram page to keep up to date with the latest news and events around the club. Please note that the instagram messages are not always monitored. I hope this helps!

patterns: Do i need to book classes

Can i cancel a class booking
responses: All classes (including paid programs like tennis and swimming lessons) can be booked directly on the DL app. They can also be cancelled through the 'class bookings' section on your app.

patterns: What is ignite
what is ign1te
is ignite for all levels
Tell me more about ignite
responses:
IGN1TE is a choreographed cardio-based workout. Each class is designed to test your whole body as you kick, punch, jump, run and push yourself to the limit. Challenging and fun for all levels, IGN1TE is perfect for anyone looking for a high-energy cardio and strength workout that blends a range of athletic and martial arts-based movements. Add high-energy music and our motivating trainers, and you have a HIIT class like no other.

If you’ve already tried and love BLAZE, our full-body HIIT workout, IGN1TE is the perfect opportunity to mix up your routine and try something a little different. 

During a 30 or 45-minute IGN1TE class, your instructor will take you through a series of exercises, culminating in one final push that’s set to our signature AMRAP (as many rounds as possible) track to finish off the class. IGN1TE has three main training focuses: speed, strength and strike. Each class will incorporate the following key elements:

Warm up: Introduces basic moves seen through the workout to warm up the muscles and increase the heart rate.
Progressive cardio: Adds more impact and directional movements to start increasing intensity.
Strike #1: Martial art-inspired movements which will continue to increase the heart rate. With more of a lower body focus, this is a great opportunity to condition the quads and glutes and get the legs fired up.
Athletic HIIT: Your first heart rate peak – challenges the heart rate with explosive and powerful movements and short recovery phases.
Strength & Conditioning: Improves muscular strength and endurance with a mixture of lower and upper body exercises that challenge the core. Designed to sculpt lean muscle.
Agility & Power: Second cardio peak – spike the heart rate as you improve your agility, speed, and power. Reaction time and balance will also be tested.
Strike #2: Second martial arts track – this time with more of an upper body focus to burn out the shoulders.
AMRAP: Final peak – this AMRAP (as many reps/rounds as possible) section is all about testing your fitness levels and pushing yourself through repetition or time-based drills.
Dynamic cooldown: Brings the heart rate down with a dynamic recovery involving flowing movements to keep the body active, help stretch muscles, and increase range of motion.
Not only is IGN1TE great for your overall cardiovascular health, but HIIT is the ideal workout to burn calories and increase endurance. Exclusive to David Lloyd Clubs, you can find IGN1TE classes at all David Lloyd Clubs across the UK.

patterns: What is spirit
is spirit for all levels
Tell me more about spirit
responses:
SPIRIT classes bring together strength, power, energy and calm for a holistic experience that will help you reset for the day ahead, or help you to wind down in the evening. Set to beautiful, motivating music, this workout is a journey of postures that are centered around building core strength, while increasing flexibility and mobility. Ending with a mindful sound meditation, SPIRIT classes give you an opportunity to slow down and focus on you and your personal wellness for a little while.

 Your SPIRIT instructor will guide you through the unique class experience. Each class follows a similar format, starting with a warmup designed to create an engaged mindset, mobilise the key muscle groups and to set the scene for the class. The order and specific moves may vary, but each class will include a combination of the following:

Sun salutation: focuses on releasing tension in hamstrings, shoulders and chest, increasing range of motion in joints.
Standing strong: increases the tempo and raises heart rate so you start to feel the burn in your muscles. Key moves will strengthen muscle groups and joints in the lower body (calves, thighs, ankles) and back.
Balance: dials it down a little to calm heart rate. Moves focus to the core to boost stability and help build better posture.
Flow: combines moves into a sequence that will help build confidence. The music will guide the tempo and movement.
Posterior: exercises focused on the back, that will reduce the risk of injury and help balance the body’s physique.
Core: leads to better balance and stability while improving posture.
Stretch: focuses on releasing tension, improving flexibility and calming the mind.
3 minutes of sound meditation

patterns: What is blaze
is blaze for all levels
Tell me more about blaze
responses:
It's new, unique, like nothing you've experienced before and it's exclusive to David Lloyd clubs. Blaze is a HIIT class that will test your strength, stamina, and willpower as you run, lift and fight. It will push you to your limit.

Make your way round the different stations as light, sound and energy power you through your workout while our instructors challenge you to achieve results you never thought possible. Plus, a Myzone heart-rate belt will track your performance so you'll work your body at the right intensity.

Myzone is a wearable heart-rate based system that guarantees accurate and personalised results to help you make the most of your workout. It monitors heart rate, calories and time exercising and converts the results into Myzone Effort Points (MEPs) – so the focus is on rewarding effort rather than fitness.

Your Myzone stats are projected onto digital screens in the form of colour-coded, easy-to-read tiles, so you can keep track of your progress throughout your Blaze session!

There’s also the free Myzone App, making it easy for you to stream your activity, upload your data and review your results from your smart phone.

patterns: What is boditrax
What is bodytrax
Tell me more about boxitrax
Tell me more about bodytracks
responses: Boditrax is an amazingly clever system that assesses your body and, very quickly, delivers 14 different measurements, such as your ideal weight, your BMI and your metabolic age, as well as your fat and muscle mass. It’s completely free to use, and you can also get a free review of your results with a personal trainer. Then you can use those results to set some new fitness goals and track how you’re doing. It’s definitely worth a try. I hope this helps!
